The patient is an 82-year-old male with a history of end-stage renal disease (ESRD) on hemodialysis, hypertension, diabetes mellitus type II with peripheral neuropathy, and atrial fibrillation on Coumadin. The patient's vital signs are stable, but he has an elevated blood pressure. He is currently off Nicardipine and will be managed with oral and intravenous medications.

The plan includes controlling hypertension with metoprolol and Hydralazine, up-titrating metoprolol as needed, and possibly adding Amlodipine in the morning if the patient continues to have high blood pressure. Neurological checks will be done every four hours, and the patient will continue on Keppra 500 mg PO BID.

For the subdural hematoma, the patient's stable condition on the CT scan will be monitored with blood pressure control as mentioned above. Neurological checks will also be done every four hours, and the patient will continue on Keppra 500 mg PO BID. Follow-up nephrology recommendations will be followed, and the patient will continue with hemodialysis three times a week.

Regarding diabetes management, oral anti-hyperglycemics will be held, and regular insulin sliding scale will be used while the patient is in-house.
